conclusion: The coil is rotating with an angular velocity ω in a uniform magnetic field B.

For a rotating coil in a magnetic field, the induced electromotive force (EMF) is given by the equation: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ A ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt) where N is the number of turns in the coil, A is the area of the coil, ω is the angular velocity, t is the time.
The coil is square with side length L.

premise: The coil is square with side length L.
conclusion: The area A of the coil is L².

premise: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ A ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt) and A = L².
conclusion: The equation for the induced EMF becomes: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt).
The effective or root mean square (RMS) value of an alternating EMF is given by: 𝓔_{rms} = 𝓔_{max}/√2 where 𝓔_{max} is the maximum value of the EMF.

premise: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt).
conclusion: The maximum value 𝓔_{max} is N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω.
The RMS value is 𝓔_{rms} = (N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω)/√2.
